intro: Conyza sprengelii, commonly known as Sprengel's weed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate leaves that are usually lance-shaped. Its flowers are yellow, with tubular corollas, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Conyza sprengelii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
